Create an Instance¶

This service allows the creation of a new instance, provided its context, class name and JSON.

Basic usage

$ curl -i -X POST -T "new_york_city.json" http://brainiak.semantica.dev.globoi.com/place/City

HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Server: nginx
Date: Tue, 14 Jan 2014 18:39:10 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 359
Connection: keep-alive
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *

{"errors": ["Valor incorreto para a propriedade (http://semantica.globo.com/place/latitude). Um (http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float) era esperado, mas (-22.958314) foi fornecido.", "Valor incorreto para a propriedade (http://semantica.globo.com/place/longitude). Um (http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float) era esperado, mas (-43.407133) foi fornecido."]}

Warning

When using curl, the “-T” param will append the filename to the actual URL, if the URL parameter ends with a “/”. In order to avoid that, either remove the last “/” or use ‘-d @new_york_city.json’ to expand the file contents.

Sample JSON “new_city.json” for the class City:

{
    "@context": {
        "rdf": "http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#",
        "place": "http://semantica.globo.com/place/",
        "rdfs": "http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#",
        "base": "http://semantica.globo.com/base/",
        "upper": "http://semantica.globo.com/upper/"
    },
    "upper:name": "Globoland",
    "upper:fullName": "Globoland (RJ)",
    "rdfs:comment": "City of Globo's companies. Historically known as PROJAC.",
    "place:partOfState": "base:UF_RJ",
    "place:latitude": "-22.958314",
    "place:longitude": "-43.407133"
}

Note that prefixes are defined in the “@context” section. Default prefixes are implicit and don’t need to be declared.

Besides using POST to create new instances, it is also possible to use PUT (for more information, see Edit a Instance). In this case, the instance_id should be provided, which must be unique in the specified context. The recommended policy is to use POST, as it will assure uniqueness of the identifiers.

Optional query string parameters¶

graph_uri: Set the graph URI, for cases where the URI is not like http://semantica.globo.com/CONTEXT_NAME

class_uri: Set the class URI, for cases where the URI is not like http://semantica.globo.com/CONTEXT_NAME/CLASS_NAME

class_prefix: by default, the class URI is defined by the API’s convention (context_uri/class_name). If the convention doesn’t apply, provide class_prefix so the URI will be: class_prefix/class_name. Example:

'http://brainiak.semantica.dev.globoi.com/place/City/?class_prefix=http%3A//dbpedia.org/'

If no class_prefix had been provided, the class URI above would be resolved as: http://semantica.globo.com/place/City. As class_prefix was defined, the class URI will be: http://dbpedia.org/City.

Possible responses¶

Status 201

The instance was created successfully, the response body is empty. The URI of the new instance is identified by the “Location” header in the HTTP response.

Note that the URI of a instance is not the same as the URL to retrieve a instance from the API. For retrieving it, use the retrieve instance primitive <>.

Status 400

If there are unknown parameters in the request, the response status code is 400 and the body contains a JSON containing valid and invalid parameters.

{
    "errors": [
        "HTTP error: 400\nO argumento invalid_param n\u00e3o \u00e9 suportado. Os argumentos de querystring suportados s\u00e3o: class_prefix, class_uri, expand_object_properties, expand_uri, graph_uri, instance_prefix, instance_uri, lang, meta_properties."
    ]
}

The 400 status may also happen when the JSON provided is invalid:

{

    "errors": ["HTTP error: 400\nNo JSON object could be decoded"]
}

Status 404

If the class does not exist, the response status code is 404.

{
    "errors": [
        "HTTP error: 404\nA classe http://semantica.globo.com/place/Person n\u00e3o existe no contexto http://semantica.globo.com/place/."
    ]
}

Status 500

Internal server error. Please, contact the team <semantica@corp.globo.com> and provide the URL, JSON and error message.
